name: Western Riviera Lakeside Lodging & Events

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My gf and I made late plans to stay at the Western Riviera for Labor Day weekend. At first, we were bummed we didn't get into one of their Lakeshore cabins, but we were still extremely pleased with the courtyard cabins. The suite was huge and clean...and being on crutches for the entire trip, the bathroom was perfectly handicapped accessible. We didn't have the Lake view, but we were still less than a minutes walk away from the Lake and all of Main St.
reviews.title: Absolutely will go back again!

reviews.text: The beds were standard hotel soft, and the only real annoyance was we could hear some bar or party a ways away until at least 1am.
reviews.title: Awesome views, wonderful place

reviews.text: Next time we go to Grand Lake, we'll definitely be staying here again...and we'll bring groceries for the full kitchen, so we won't have to spend $40 a meal! Ack! :-)
reviews.title: Great Inn in a lovely setting!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks for the great stay!
reviews.title: Court yard cabins are Great

reviews.text: Our trip to Grand Lake was the best vacation we have taken. The views are beautiful, the room was comfortable and clean and the town was much fun. We absolutely love the Western Riviera, great place to stay.
reviews.title: Outstanding...as always!

reviews.text: The hotel is located at a small sandy beach at the lake. Rooms are simple but comfortable and clean. The view from the rooms is really great!! At the back of the hotel there is a small cafe and bakery where they sell great breakfast. We tried out the bagels and they were delicious! Any one visiting the Rocky Mountains N.P. should stay in Grand Lake instead of the over-commercialised city of Estes Park. Grand Lake is a cute and quiet small town and just a few minutes driving from the entrance to the National Park.
reviews.title: Simple but nice rooms, great location!

reviews.text: A walk-in reservation. Front desk was helpful and friendly. Room was awesome right off the lake with a great view. VERY QUIET! Within walking distance of the quaint downtown with restaurants and shops. Loved it and would stay again in a minute!!
reviews.title: Killer location, dated rooms

reviews.text: The location of this motel is amazing! You are ON the lake and on the main street, you can walk everywhere!
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: The rooms themselves, well they could use sone help. They are very dated from the sparkly popcorn ceiling to the 70's bathrooms. Everything is clean, but it sort of smells like a old-folks home! We bought an air-freshener the first day!
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel with great views
Absolutely beautiful view, accomodations, service, atmosphere and great price!
reviews.text: We were so lucky to find Western Riviera. We cancelled our plans to stay in Estes Park for the "less touristy" Grand Lake. The Western Riviera was so accomodating and everyone very friendly. They even had a buy 2 get one free offer that made our stay less expensive than any budget hotel, even though this is a first class establishment. GREAT view, walking distance to town, restaurants and shopping. No need to look any farther, you have found a great place in the Western Riviera. We travel to National Parks every year and we plan to return to WR in Grand Lake. THANK YOU for helping to make our vacation in Colorado one of the best ever! I would recommend to anyone. We had my parents with us and they were so happy to sit on the deck and watch the hummingbirds. close to many attractions, Adams Falls, Rocky Mountain National Park Entrance...if you are a moose lover like me this is your location. We saw 17 moose including a baby just inside the park from the Grand Lake side. Forget about Estes Park, way too crowded and so many tourists. Western Riviera, we plan to come back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently my BH and I went to the Grand Lake area and on the spur of the moment decided to spend the night since we were having such a great time. We didn't know if on short notice we would be able to find lodging, but the local Chamber of Commerce recommended the Western Riviera Motel. We called and spoke with Ann and she hooked us up with a lovely room with a king sized bed.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and hospitality!

reviews.text: The views are amazing, and the room is clean and the motel is located close to everything in downtown Grand Lake. We were able to walk to Pancho and Lefty's Mexican Restaurant for a late lunch (good live music and and nice bar staff).
reviews.title: Room with a view...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is in the perfect location if you want great lake views and close to the downtown area.
reviews.title: The wintery scenery is breathtaking & we loved the lake view from our place.

reviews.text: I highly recommned the Wester Riviera Motel for a laid back, casual, Colorado experience. We hope to return soon.
reviews.title: The perfect place for family to gather, relax and celebrate any occasion

reviews.text: We have had the pleasure of staying at all the Western Riveria's locations including the courtyard cabins, condo, lakeside motel & cabins, and have used the event center for a wedding reception. What fabulous service, hospitality and breathtaking views at all locations. We keep going back year after year! A great family time!
reviews.title: absolutely fabulous location & hospitality

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay in the Wester Riviera Hotel. We stayed in the apartment room with the full kitchen and entertained 4 - 12 year old girls for a Birthday Celebration. Our room was clean and completely accomodated our cooking, sleeping and recreational needs. The girls entertained themselves with putt-putt, paddle boating, art show across the street, shopping, go carts, movies, hiking, bowling, swimming and board games supplied by the hotel. It was the most memorable birthday party and the two moms had a wonderful weekend and enjoyed the wonderful restaurants within walking distance. We would receommend this hotel to any family looking for fun for adults and children.
reviews.title: The Best 12th Birthday Party Ever

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in a medium cabin "Fox Den" with our 17 month old. It had all we needed for our 4 night stay-stove, fridge and microwave. We loved the walk in shower (we carried a small baby tub to bathe our daughter). It was nice opening the windows to let in the cool mountain air, although there was a bar nearby whose music could be well heard at night...but it really didn't bother us too much. Our only complaint was the internet service. They seemed to have problems with the server the entire time we were there, so my husband wasn't able to do some work (good for me, bad for him). We will definitely consider another stay here when we are able to get back to Grand Lake.
reviews.title: the cabin definitely exceeded my expectations

aka: Western Riviera Lakeside Lodging & Events Hotel
description: Western Riviera offers lodging and an events venue overlooking Colorado's largest natural lake, Grand Lake, at the west entrance to Rocky Mountain National Park surrounded by mountain vistas. Open year-round.
